issues.description: Constructor parameter mismatch: The problem statement (UML and example Main) and the template expect animals to be constructed with a single String name (e.g., Seal("Clarabelle")), and the UML for Animal shows only a name attribute. The solution repository, however, implements Animal and all concrete animals with a two-parameter constructor (String name, int age). This difference will confuse students about the required constructors and will cause incompatibility with the example usage in the template Main and the UML description.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor signatures consistent across artifacts. Either update the problem statement and template Main to specify and use two-argument constructors (String name, int age) and include the age attribute in the UML, or modify the solution to remove the age attribute and provide single-argument constructors (String name) for Animal and all concrete animals so they match the UML and template usage.

issues.description: Attribute mismatch: The UML and problem text describe Animal as having a single attribute 'name: String'. The solution's Animal class introduces an extra attribute 'age: int' (with getters/setters). This additional attribute is not mentioned in the problem specification or UML and alters the data model students must implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the data model between problem statement and solution. Either remove the 'age' attribute from the solution's Animal class (and adjust constructors accordingly) so Animal only has a 'name' attribute as per the UML, or update the problem statement and UML to document the 'age' attribute and require constructors/getters/setters for it.
